column4: i am trying to install a driver and it is giving me error messages because my kernal does not include prebuilt modules? what does that mean????
what driver ?
are you using default ubuntu kernel ?
what error messages are you getting ?
probably you will need to install kernel-source
sudo apt-get install linux-source
that command does nto work, i get this error E: Could not get lock /var/lib/dpkg/lock - open (11 Resource temporarily unavailable)
probably synaptic is open
let us to know what error messages are you getting
here is the first msg i get No pre-built modules for: Ubuntu-6.06 linux-2.6.15-23-386 i686
are you using hsf installer ? Or are you trying to compile the driver by hand ?
that installer gives you some other option ?
tell me exactly whats your modem (Ill try to find a suitable module for it)
lspci returns what ?
Intel Corporation 82801FB/FBM/FR/FW/FRW (ICH6 Family) IDE Controller (rev 04)
nice. Wait a minute please
is it your modem device ?
thats all the information i have, i emailed the maker of this laptop about the chipset and they just told me to dl the hsf driver
http://sourceforge.net/projects/ac97-modem/
this is your driver ?
it might be i dont know, but that file to download is broken
your driver is linuxant ?
